meanings.sent1: The children caused a ruckus in the classroom during recess.
meanings.sent2: The party next door created a ruckus that kept us awake all night.
meanings.sent3: The ruckus at the zoo was caused by the monkeys stealing bananas.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm outside sounded like a ruckus of angry giants.
meanings.sent5: The ruckus of the marching band filled the stadium with energy.

meanings.definition: To make a noisy disturbance or commotion.
meanings.sent1: Please don't ruckus in the library; people are trying to study.
meanings.sent2: The protesters decided to ruckus outside the government building.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves to ruckus around the house at night, knocking things over.
meanings.sent4: The wind began to ruckus through the trees, causing them to sway.
meanings.sent5: The excited fans started to ruckus as their favorite team scored a goal.
